=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Spencer's Mountain (DVD)
Review Date: 2018/02/09
Store: Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Wally Cox, James Mac Arthur, Donald Crisp, Delmer Daves, Maureen O'Hara, Henry Fonda", 'Initial release date': '2005-02-08', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Unqualified', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2289677', 'Director': 'Delmer Daves', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 8, 2005', 'Actors': "Maureen O'Hara, Henry Fonda, James Mac Arthur, Donald Crisp, Wally Cox", 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Delmer Daves', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Delmer Daves', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Pineapple Express / Superbad / Youth in Revolt (2010) / Year One
Review Date: 2018/09/28
Store: Seth Rogen  (Actor),     James Franco  (Actor)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Pineapple Express (2008)', "Stoner Dale Denton's (Seth Rogen) enjoyment of a rare strain of marijuana may prove fatal when he drops his roach in a panic after witnessing a murder. Upon learning that the fancy weed can be traced back to them, Dale and his dealer (James Franco) go on the lam, with a dangerous drug lord (Gary Cole) and crooked cop (Rosie Perez) hot on their heels.", 'Superbad (2007)', 'Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.', 'Year One (2009)', 'After Neanderthal hunter Zed (Jack Black) is exiled for eating forbidden fruit, he and his sardonic buddy Oh (Michael Cera) leave their village and begin an epic journey through history. The pals encounter biblical characters such as Cain (David Cross) and Abel, Abraham (Hank Azaria), and others, and wind up in Sodom. Along the way, Zed debunks commonly held beliefs and replaces them with his own delusions of grandeur.', 'Youth in Revolt (2009)', "As a fan of Albert Camus and Jean-Luc Godard, teenage Nick Twisp (Michael Cera) is definitely out of his element when his mother and her boyfriend move the family to a trailer park. When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni (Portia Doubleday) plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed."]
Average Rating: 4.6

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Young Stranger
Review Date: 2018/09/28
Store: James Mac Arthur, Kim Hunter, James Daly, James Gregory, Jeffrey Silver, Whit Bissell  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ["Before he gained his fame directing cinematic masterpieces like The Manchurian Candidate and Seven Days in May, John Frankenheimer made his feature film debut with this sensitive father-son drama about troubled youth. When clean-cut Hal Ditmar (Hawaii Five-O's James MacArthur), son of a wealthy movie producer (James Daly), gets into a fight with a movie theater manager (Whit Bissell) no one believes he acted in self-defense. With the police concerned that they have another juvenile delinquent on their hands, Hal's mother (Kim Hunter) thinks the problem lies in the growing gulf between father and son. Heartfelt and effective, Frankenheimer's already sure hand at the helm and the talent that star MacArthur shared with his illustrious mother Helen Hayes buoy The Young Stranger above the common ground of 1950's delinquency dramas."]
Average Rating: 4.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Big Valley - Season 2, Volume 1
Review Date: 2018/09/28
Store: Richard Long  (Actor),     Peter Breck  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'BIG VALLEY Season 2 Volume 1 continues the adventures of the wealthy and powerful Barkley family in the untamed Old West.', 'Amazon.com', "Eugene Barkley, we hardly knew ye. The youngest of the Barkley sons (quick--who portrayed him? That's right; Charles Briles) is nowhere to be found in", 'The Big Valley', '\'s sophomore season. But lawyer Jarrod (Richard Long), hot-headed Nick (Peter Breck), soulful "bastard son" Heath (Lee Majors), and coltish daughter Audra (Linda Evans) get into all the trouble and two-fisted action they can handle. And there\'s nothing the close-knit Barkleys, headed by matriarch Victoria (regally billed as "Miss Barbara Stanwyck") can\'t handle, whether it\'s defending the family name against the false accusations of an unscrupulous, grudge-bearing politician, rescuing Heath from a Mexican prison, or being abandoned in the desert. The drama of Heath\'s heritage, a focus of season 1, is settled once and for all in the season opener, "The Lost Treasure," in which a con man claims to be Heath\'s father. By episode\'s end, even Nick is calling Heath "brother."', 'Season 2 boasts an impressive roster of character actors, several at the beginning of their careers. Buddy Hackett, sporting a Lucky Charms leprechaun brogue, is the con man in "The Lost Treasure," with Bruce Dern as one of his marks, and Dub Taylor tending a ghost town bar. Colleen Dewhurst guest stars in the episode "A Day of Terror, as outlaw Annie Morton, who holds Victoria and Audra hostage while her injured son recuperates in a church. James Whitmore is the mud-slinging candidate in "Target." Warren Oates heads a band of bumbling brothers trying to open a stubborn railroad station safe in "The Great Safe Robbery." And that\'s the future Jan Brady, Eve Plumb as a little girl trapped in a well in "Hide the Children," an excellent episode that deals with intolerance as gypsy-hating Nick gets a change of attitude when he accompanies a gypsy bride and her family to her wedding.', 'The Big Valley', 'was never a ratings rival to the venerable', 'Gunsmoke', 'or Bonanza, which still ruled the prime time roost in 1966. But Western buffs will feel right at home with this sprawling family saga and its larger than life characters. Buyers, though, will be paying a higher premium for the Barkley property this time around. Priced the same as the season 1 set, this collection contains only the first 15 episodes of season 2 and no extra features.', '--Donald Liebenson']
Average Rating: 4.7

When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni (Portia Doubleday) plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed."]

The Young Stranger
James Mac Arthur, Kim Hunter, James Daly, James Gregory, Jeffrey Silver, Whit Bissell  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
["Before he gained his fame directing cinematic masterpieces like The Manchurian Candidate and Seven Days in May, John Frankenheimer made his feature film debut with this sensitive father-son drama about troubled youth. When clean-cut Hal Ditmar (Hawaii Five-O's James MacArthur), son of a wealthy movie producer (James Daly), gets into a fight with a movie theater manager (Whit Bissell) no one believes he acted in self-defense. With the police concerned that they have another juvenile delinquent on their hands, Hal's mother (Kim Hunter) thinks the problem lies in the growing gulf between father and son. Heartfelt and effective, Frankenheimer's already sure hand at the helm and the talent that star MacArthur shared with his illustrious mother Helen Hayes buoy The Young Stranger above the common ground of 1950's delinquency dramas."]

Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General
['Product Description', 'BIG VALLEY Season 2 Volume 1 continues the adventures of the wealthy and powerful Barkley family in the untamed Old West.', 'Amazon.com', "Eugene Barkley, we hardly knew ye. The youngest of the Barkley sons (quick--who portrayed him? That's right; Charles Briles) is nowhere to be found in", 'The Big Valley', '\'s sophomore season. But lawyer Jarrod (Richard Long), hot-headed Nick (Peter Breck), soulful "bastard son" Heath (Lee Majors), and coltish daughter Audra (Linda Evans) get into all the trouble and two-fisted action they can handle. And there\'s nothing the close-knit Barkleys, headed by matriarch Victoria (regally billed as "Miss Barbara Stanwyck") can\'t handle, whether it\'s defending the family name against the false accusations of an unscrupulous, grudge-bearing politician, rescuing Heath from a Mexican prison, or being abandoned in the desert. The drama of Heath\'s heritage, a focus of season 1, is settled once and for all in the season opener, "The Lost Treasure," in which a con man claims to be Heath\'s father. By episode\'s end, even Nick is calling Heath "brother."', 'Season 2 boasts an impressive roster of character actors, several at the beginning of their careers. Buddy Hackett, sporting a Lucky Charms leprechaun brogue, is the con man in "The Lost Treasure," with Bruce Dern as one of his marks, and Dub Taylor tending a ghost town bar. Colleen Dewhurst guest stars in the episode "A Day of Terror, as outlaw Annie Morton, who holds Victoria and Audra hostage while her injured son recuperates in a church. James Whitmore is the mud-slinging candidate in "Target." Warren Oates heads a band of bumbling brothers trying to open a stubborn railroad station safe in "The Great Safe Robbery." And that\'s the future Jan Brady, Eve Plumb as a little girl trapped in a well in "Hide the Children," an excellent episode that deals with intolerance as gypsy-hating Nick gets a change of attitude when he accompanies a gypsy bride and her family to her wedding.', 'The Big Valley', 'was never a ratings rival to the venerable', 'Gunsmoke', 'or Bonanza, which still ruled the prime time roost in 1966. But Western buffs will feel right at home with this sprawling family saga and its larger than life characters. Buyers, though, will be paying a higher premium for the Barkley property this time around. Priced the same as the season 1 set, this collection contains only the first 15 episodes of season 2 and no extra features.', '--Donald Liebenson']

Product Title: Spencer's Mountain (DVD)

Store: Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.8

Product Description: ['Pineapple Express (2008)', "Stoner Dale Denton's (Seth Rogen) enjoyment of a rare strain of marijuana may prove fatal when he drops his roach in a panic after witnessing a murder. Upon learning that the fancy weed can be traced back to them, Dale and his dealer (James Franco) go on the lam, with a dangerous drug lord (Gary Cole) and crooked cop (Rosie Perez) hot on their heels.", 'Superbad (2007)', 'Two inseparable best friends navigate the last weeks of high school and are invited to a gigantic house party. Together with their nerdy friend, they spend a long day trying to score enough alcohol to supply the party and inebriate two girls in order to kick-start their sex lives before they go off to college. Their quest is complicated after one of them falls in with two inept cops who are determined to show him a good time.', 'Year One (2009)', 'After Neanderthal hunter Zed (Jack Black) is exiled for eating forbidden fruit, he and his sardonic buddy Oh (Michael Cera) leave their village and begin an epic journey through history. The pals encounter biblical characters such as Cain (David Cross) and Abel, Abraham (Hank Azaria), and others, and wind up in Sodom. Along the way, Zed debunks commonly held beliefs and replaces them with his own delusions of grandeur.', 'Youth in Revolt (2009)', "As a fan of Albert Camus and Jean-Luc Godard, teenage Nick Twisp (Michael Cera) is definitely out of his element when his mother and her boyfriend move the family to a trailer park. When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni (Portia Doubleday) plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed."]

raw_response:
**Shopping Preferences:**

- **Genre Affinity:** Strong preference for *Westerns* and *Family/Drama* films, indicated by repeated purchases in these categories.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Frequently revisits childhood favorites, suggesting a sentimental attachment to shows and movies watched in youth.
- **Ratings:** Consistently rates products high (4.0-5.0), reflecting a positive view of quality content.
- **Family-Oriented Content:** Exhibits a strong inclination towards family-friendly movies, emphasizing wholesome and uplifting narratives.
- **Actor Preferences:** Shows a pattern of favoring specific actors, particularly those known for classic family and dramatic roles.
- **Multi-Viewing:** Enjoys re-watching favorites, highlighting satisfaction with content that resonates emotionally.
- **Overall Trends:** Casual television and movie viewer seeking comfort in familiar genres with emotional depth and family values.

target_interaction.title: Great Shows
target_interaction.text: I bought this for my Parents who like Westerns. Some of the shows have poor quality not clear. My Parents still could watch and liked this Dvd.
description: Take a trip down memory lane with this collection of unforgettable Western series. Heroes and villains share the screen in these favorites from the past. From the detectives of the Southwestern Railroad, to the sheriff of Cochise County, upholding the law and chasing down crafty criminals are all the rage in these 70 classics featuring
Jim Davis, Mary Castle, Clayton Moore, Jay Silverheels, John Bromfield, Scott Brady, Duncan Renaldo, Leo Carillo
and a whole slew of memorable guest stars.
Detectives for the Southwestern Railroad, Matt Clark (
) solve cases and ward off evildoers threatening harm to the railway.
)—atop his stallion, Silver, and with his sidekick, Tonto (
)—travels the West, righting whatever wrongs come his way.
stars as Frank Morgan, the sheriff of Cochise County, Arizona. Promoted to U.S. Marshal, Morgan has his work cut out for him as he tries to defeat criminals and keep the entire state safe.
is Shotgun Slade—a detective whose law-enforcing travels include solving crimes and using his over-and-under-style shotgun to level justice.
)—misunderstood by lawmen as criminals—ride the West, upholding justice for the poor.
